entries.author: konstantin_uvarin
entries.text: Konstantin explains why refute? As he claims successful prove run actually proves nothing. It's only the failures that are meaningful! This is similar to falsifiability concept in modern science: we don't prove a theory in experiment; instead, we try hard to refute it. Same goes for runtime assertions.
entries.title: Assert::Refute - Unified and assertion tool
